ATIA.content: Descartes’ argument is not that animals don’t resemble humans (they do!), it’s that we can’t make an interior analogy (judgment) based on exterior resemblance > methodological fiction of men only seeing men, an ends of the animal (not man): 1) phenomenological question: is there world w/out animal? 2) a real hypothesis (if you’ll permit me): after animality, a sort of holocaust
